step_feedback.feedback: For step 1, focus on keeping your shoulders and elbows more stable. Try to minimize movement in these areas as you begin the exercise.
In step 2, aim for greater precision with your shoulder and elbow positioning. Your wrists also need more consistent alignment with the rest of your arm.
Step 3 shows good control of your shoulders and elbows. Continue to refine your wrist position for better overall form.
For step 4, your shoulders and elbows are looking much better! Keep working on maintaining that stability, and pay attention to your wrist alignment.
Step 5 shows excellent control of your shoulders and elbows. Your wrists are also much more consistent now. Great job!

exercise_summary: You're doing a great job with the Push Down Pumping exercise! Focus on keeping your shoulders and elbows steady, especially in the initial steps. Your wrist alignment is improving, which helps with the arm strength and lymph drainage.
